channel.title: What DAW is the best for beginners
channel.description: I wanted to know, which DAW is the best for someone with not much experience, but can still make quality music?

item.source: What DAW is the best for beginners

item.title: What DAW is the best for beginners
item.dc:creator: NickElle
item.description:
But, here’s something that people keep coming back to:

They say Auxy music is “just as good as other music made on with a DAW.”

I don’t believe that the statement above is a good one because a DAW is NOT the GOAL.
The goal is making great music.

A great song can come from tons of places. It can come from anywhere*, like a dual-deck tape player (overdubbing loops tons of times), a sampler, a mixer and an audio recorder, a DAW, or most recently, the iOS app (Auxy, Medly, Groovebox, etc). So, there is no need for comparing “Auxy music” to “DAW music,” because there is NO SUCH THING. It’s just music. GREAT music, to be exact.

*But, different ways to make music have different limitations. For example, even though recording with tape is cool, it sucks because it takes FOREVER, and with a mixer, you need to have some experience as an audio engineer to get anywhere, because it’s not very easy to only be able to listen to sound and not see it.
So, just like those classic methods, Auxy has it’s limitations, too.

Read full topic
item.source: What DAW is the best for beginners

item.title: What DAW is the best for beginners
item.dc:creator: NickElle
item.description:
Yes, you’re right about it being a Grooovebox, and not a sequencer.

item.source: What DAW is the best for beginners

item.title: What DAW is the best for beginners
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
Agree, and disagree. I think it HEAVILY depends on the kind of music you write.

For me, it’s like 75% there. I’m not gonna lie, if I don’t get EVERYTHING I want in this next update probably gonna use a Auxy/GarageBand combo. I’m kind of mentally setting myself up for it. But for certain styles, I think it’s 100%.

Some of the stuff I’ve heard this community come up with rivals what I hear on Electronica radio on Pandora, so I know it’s got to mean something

Read full topic

item.title: What DAW is the best for beginners
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
NickElle:

I don’t consider Auxy to be a DAW. It’s still a sequencer.

Sequencers characteristically don’t include built-in sounds/sound generation, so maybe a soft ‘groovebox’?

I personally consider Auxy a DAW, albeit a feature-reduced one, but ‘groovebox’ also seems an apt description.

Read full topic

item.title: What DAW is the best for beginners
item.dc:creator: brandnaqua
item.description:
They changed the price of FLSM to $899 to redirect customers to the proper version. That one is only there for older customers who want to get the updates from the one they purchased long ago. Long story short they used to be two different apps and then they just updated both of them to the current UI and have it in place for those who paid for it a long time ago. I’m weary on the exact 100% details, but something like that.
